intro: Torulinium odoratum subsp. auriculatum, commonly known as the auriculate torulinium, is a flowering plant species native to specific regions in southern Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream sides. The subspecies is distinguished by its auriculate (ear-shaped) leaf bases, which are a key identifying feature.
